title: Robin Hood's Stride Walking Route

images.title: Outlying rocks at Robin Hood's Stride by Andrew Hill, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Outlying rocks at the site

images.title: Martin Speck / Robin Hood's Stride from near Cratcliff Rocks
images.caption: Robin Hood's Stride from near Cratcliff Rocks. The rocks were seen in the film The Princess Bride. An episode of The Return of Sherlock Holmes, 'The Priory School' (broadcast on ITV, 13 August 1986) also featured this location.

images.title: Rock tor, Robin Hood's Stride by Andrew Hill, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Rock tor

images.title: Alan Heardman / View from Hermit's Cave area towards Robin Hood's Stride
images.caption: View from Hermit's Cave area. The cave contains a crucifix carving dated stylistically to the 13th or 14th century.

images.title: View to Robin Hood's Stride by Andrew Hill, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: View to Robin Hood's Stride

images.caption: Crags at Cratcliff

images.title: Across the valley from the top of Cratcliff by Andrew Hill, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Across the valley from the top of Cratcliff

images.title: Douglal, CC BY-SA 4.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Nine Stones Close stone circle on Harthill Moor. The Bronze Age stone circle is a short walk north from the Stride.

description: This walk visits Robin Hood's Stride, a wonderful rock formation near Bakewell in Derbyshire. The walk starts from the free Cratcliffe Parking area just south of the site. The roadside parking area is located on the B5056 just west of Birchover . Head south down the road and then turn turn right to link up with the Limestone Way . You can follow this waymarked footpath north to visit the photogenic rocks and viewpoint. It's a popular spot for rock climbing and walking with the atmospheric site surrounded by some lovely countryside. Local legend says it is a spot where Robin Hood once stood to look out on his surroundings. On the way you'll also pass the Hermit's Cave and Cratcliff where there are more interesting rock formations. Just to the north there's the Bronze Age Nine Stones Close Stone Circle to visit if you have time.
